content: in this court case two parties were involved in a dispute over the dissolution of a shared property the property in question was a house in canolo and a piece of land in reggio calabria the court deemed the request for dissolution inadmissible but ordered the division of the property the plaintiff was given exclusive ownership of the house in canolo while the defendant was awarded a sum of eur 14000 the court referred to relevant articles of the civil code and inheritance division rules the decision was based on evidence including an experts report on the properties the court found that the building on the land in pe was not properly permitted and needed to be demolished however the house in canolo met the requirements and could be divided due to the costs and uncertainties of selling the property at auction the court decided to assign the house exclusively to one owner the value of the property was determined by an experts report and the plaintiff was ordered to pay the defendant a balance amount the costs of the proceedings were to be shared equally between the parties the court in reggio calabria made a final ruling on october 26 2021 declaring the application for dissolution improper and ordering the dissolution of the community property in canolo nu the applicant was granted exclusive ownership of a property in canolo and was also required to pay the defendant eur 14000 the costs and fees of the proceedings would be offset between the parties and they were also responsible for sharing the costs of the courtappointed experts report

metadata.CASE_ID: Tribunale Reggio Calabria sez. II, 27/10/2021, n.1378
